message:
WEEK 1 — Foundation: Learn Supersets

Welcome to time-efficient training. 3 full-body sessions per week using supersets—pair 2 exercises with minimal transition time (<15sec), rest 60-90sec between supersets. Each session: 30-35 minutes.

This Week:
- Day 1: Full Body A (Push emphasis)
- Day 2: Rest/active recovery
- Day 3: Full Body B (Pull emphasis)
- Day 4: Rest/active recovery
- Day 5: Full Body C (Lower emphasis)
- Days 6-7: Rest

Scheduling: Flexible. Mon/Wed/Fri recommended, or any 3 non-consecutive days.

Intensity: RPE 6-7 (moderate, learn pacing)
Session time: 30-35 min
Optional finishers: 5-10min cardio (skip if no time)

Focus this week: Master transitions between exercises. Don't rush—quality over speed. Track transition times and loads used. Consistency over perfection—3 focused sessions beats missing workouts.
qualityNotes: Introduces superset concept with specific metrics (<15sec transitions, 60-90sec rest)
Time commitment transparent (30-35min sessions)
Flexible scheduling emphasized (any 3 non-consecutive days)
7-day structure shows full week (training days + rest days)
Optional finishers noted (skip if no time—acknowledges busy lifestyle)
RPE 6-7 appropriate for learning phase
Focus on transitions, not load (skill acquisition first)
Consistency over perfection philosophy introduced early
Approachable tone for busy professionals

message:
WEEK 4 — Progressive Overload Mid-Phase

Halfway through Progressive Overload block. Loads at 70-75% 1RM (RPE 7-8). This week: add 5-10lbs to main compounds OR add 1-2 reps per set. If you failed reps 2 weeks in a row, reduce 10% and rebuild.

This Week:
- Day 1: Full Body A (squats, deadlifts heavier than Week 3)
- Day 2: Rest (prioritize sleep—7-8hr minimum)
- Day 3: Full Body B (pull-ups/rows, bench press progression)
- Day 4: Rest (skip finisher if fatigued)
- Day 5: Full Body C (lunges, overhead press progression)
- Days 6-7: Rest

Intensity: RPE 7-8 (challenging but sustainable)
Session time: 35-40 min
Optional finishers: Add if energized, skip if busy

You're stronger than Week 1. Compare loads—typical progress: 10-20% increase in 4 weeks. Track everything. Weeks 5-6 continue this progression before Week 7 peak test.
qualityNotes: Mid-phase check-in (Week 4 of 8)
Specific progression guidance (add 5-10lbs OR 1-2 reps)
Failure protocol provided (reduce 10% if failed 2 weeks running)
Each day notes what's progressing (compounds named)
Rest days include specific guidance (prioritize sleep, permission to skip finishers)
Session time increased to 35-40min (reflects additional work)
Progression expectation stated (10-20% increase in 4 weeks)
Forward-looking context (Weeks 5-6 continue, Week 7 peak test)
Balances push with sustainability (skip if busy/fatigued)

metadata.title: Week 6 — Final Push Before Peak Test

message:
WEEK 6 — Final Push Before Peak Test

Last week of Progressive Overload before Week 7 peak (75-80% loads @ RPE 8-9) and Week 8 deload. Push for upper end of rep ranges or add 5lbs. Make every rep count.

This Week:
- Day 1: Full Body A (aim for 3×10 on squats or add weight)
- Day 2: Rest (8hr sleep if possible—recovery critical)
- Day 3: Full Body B (deadlifts 2x this week, compare to Day 1)
- Day 4: Rest (mental prep for Friday's final session)
- Day 5: Full Body C (finish strong—test your progress)
- Days 6-7: Rest (reflect on 6 weeks of work)

Intensity: RPE 7-8 (upper end of ranges)
Session time: 35-40 min (potentially 40-45 with 4th superset)

Week 7: Peak test (heavier loads, see your gains). Week 8: Deload (40% volume cut, recover, assess). You've built momentum—finish strong. Compare Week 6 to Week 1 loads. That's real progress.
qualityNotes: Context for week's role (final push before peak)
Forward-looking: Week 7 peak test, Week 8 deload outlined
Specific guidance for each day (aim for 3×10 or add weight)
Rest days include mental preparation cues
Sleep emphasis (8hr if possible)
Session time acknowledges potential 4th superset option
Reflection prompt (compare Week 6 to Week 1)
Motivational tone balanced with realism
Sets expectations for coming weeks (peak then deload)
Acknowledges effort ('You've built momentum')
